alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 9:48AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WALLACE COUNTY THROUGH 915 AM MDT... At 847 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Sharon Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sharon Springs around 855 AM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
